metadata.title: CVE-2023-52443 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:apparmor: avoid crash when parsed profile name is empty When processing apacked profile in unpack_profile() described like "profile:ns::samba-dcerpcd /usr/lib*/samba/{,samba/}samba-dcerpcd {...}" a string":samba-dcerpcd" is unpacked as a fully-qualified name and then passed toaa_splitn_fqname(). aa_splitn_fqname() treats ":samba-dcerpcd" as onlycontaining a namespace. Thus it returns NULL for tmpname, meanwhile tmpnsis non-NULL. Later aa_alloc_profile() crashes as the new profile name isNULL now. general protection fault, probably for non-canonical address0xdffffc0000000000: 0000 [#1] PREEMPT SMP KASAN NOPTI KASAN: null-ptr-derefin range [0x0000000000000000-0x0000000000000007] CPU: 6 PID: 1657 Comm:apparmor_parser Not tainted 6.7.0-rc2-dirty #16 Hardware name: QEMUStandard PC (i440FX + PIIX, 1996), BIOSrel-1.16.2-3-gd478f380-rebuilt.opensuse.org 04/01/2014 RIP:0010:strlen+0x1e/0xa0 Call Trace: <TASK> ? strlen+0x1e/0xa0aa_policy_init+0x1bb/0x230 aa_alloc_profile+0xb1/0x480unpack_profile+0x3bc/0x4960 aa_unpack+0x309/0x15e0aa_replace_profiles+0x213/0x33c0 policy_update+0x261/0x370profile_replace+0x20e/0x2a0 vfs_write+0x2af/0xe00 ksys_write+0x126/0x250do_syscall_64+0x46/0xf0 entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x6e/0x76 </TASK>---[ end trace 0000000000000000 ]--- RIP: 0010:strlen+0x1e/0xa0 It seemssuch behaviour of aa_splitn_fqname() is expected and checked in otherplaces where it is called (e.g. aa_remove_profiles). Well, there is anexplicit comment "a ns name without a following profile is allowed" inside.AFAICS, nothing can prevent unpacked "name" to be in form like":samba-dcerpcd" - it is passed from userspace. Deny the whole profile setreplacement in such case and inform user with EPROTO and an explainingmessage. Found by Linux Verification Center (linuxtesting.org).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52443` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-227-generic - 4.15.0-227.239~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-227-generic - 4.15.0-227.239~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-227-lowlatency - 4.15.0-227.239~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-aws - 4.15.0-1170.183~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1179-azure - 4.15.0-1179.194~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-227.239~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.183~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1179.194~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1164.181~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1133.144~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
